intro: Ipomoea kondaparthiensis, commonly known as the Kondaparthi morning glory, is a flowering plant native to India. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers. The plant produces heart-shaped leaves and has a climbing habit, often found in moist, tropical environments. Its flowers typically open in the morning, giving it the common name "morning glory." The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological role in its native habitat.
